newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: C&P bounces back after reaching its lowest.
newsitem.headline: C&P bounces back after reaching its lowest.

text.p: Low-cost housing developer C&P Homes Inc bounced back in early Friday trading, up 50 centavos or 5.88 percent to 9.00 pesos in moderate buying, brokers said.
C&P Homes fell to a record low on Thursday to close at 8.50 pesos after some investors dumped the shares on a belated selling over fears of a possible property crash.
C&P Homes was largely unaffected at the height of the scare because the company caters to the low-end of the market where the demand was expected to remain strong.
"Some investors just thought the selling was overdone. They are taking opportunity of the low price," one trader said.
